ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS : : FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS FACED WITH FINANCIAL CRISIS: DETAILS 22/2020 1 . ( ) (The Hon. Hesha Withanage) - (2):
(ii) ;
(ii) ;
(iii) ;
(ii) ;
(ii) ;
(iii) ;
asked the Prime Minister and Minister of Finance:
(a) Will he inform this House-
(i) the number of financial institutions registered under the Central Bank of Sri Lanka by 31.08.2020; and
(ii) the names of aforesaid financial institutions and the names of the members of the director boards?
(b) Will he also inform this House-
(i) the number of financial institutions led to financial crisis since the previous Good Governance Government came into power until 31.08.2020;
(ii) separately, the number of depositors who maintained deposits in each financial institution; and
(iii) the measures that have been taken and will be taken to do justice to the depositors of aforesaid financial institutions?
(c) If not, why? ( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Ajith Nivard Cabraal - State Minister of Money and Capital Market and State Enterprise Reforms) , , .

( ) (The Hon. Johnston Fernando) , . . . Question ordered to stand down. ( ) (The Hon. Speaker) . - : - : HOUSES WITHOUT DEEDS IN DEHIWALA-MOUNT LAVINIA DS DIVISION: PROVISION OF DEEDS 168/2020

asked the Prime Minister and Minister of Urban Development and Housing:
(a) Will he inform this House -
(i) the number of houses without land deeds located in the Dehiwala-Mount Lavinia Divisional Secretary's Division;
(ii) whether there is any arrangement to grant deeds for the aforesaid houses; and
(iii) if so, whether he will explain the manner in which the said programme will be implemented?
(b) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Johnston Fernando) , * . * : * : * Answer tabled:
(ii) .
() . : : CRICKET ASSOCIATION OF KILINOCHCHI DISTRICT: REGISTRATION
190/2020 5 . ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Sivagnanam Shritharan) - (3):
(ii) ;
(ii) ;
(ii) ;
asked the Minister of Youth and Sports:
(a) Will he inform this House of the number or cricket associations in Sri Lanka?
(b) Is he aware that -
(i) there are 25 cricket associations for the 25 administrative districts in Sri Lanka; and
(ii) the approval required for the establishment of the Cricket Association for Kilinochchi District has not hitherto been granted?
(c) Will he also inform this House of the reasons -
(i) for not granting the approval required to establish the Cricket Association for Kilinochchi District up to now; and
(ii) for not registering the Cricket Association of Kilinochchi District up to now, in spite of the applications made for registration on several occasions?
(d) Will he further inform this House of the assistance extended by the Ministry of Sports for the Cricket Association of Kilinochchi District after 2010?
(e) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Johnston Fernando) , * . * : * : * Answer tabled:
(District Cricket Associations) - 22
(Provincial Cricket Associations) - 05
(Employment Cricket Associations) - 06
(Controlling Clubs) - 29
(Affiliated Clubs) - 23
(ii) .
2015-2019 : 2015-2019 : IMPORT OF FRUITS FROM 2015-2019: DETAILS 228/2020 6 . ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Shantha Bandara on behalf of the Hon. Mohamad Muzammil) - (1):
(ii) ;
(iii) ;
(iv) ;
(ii) ;
(iii) ;
(iv) ;
asked the Minister of Trade:
(a) Will he inform this House, separately, pertaining to each of the years during the period from 2015 to 2019, of-
(i) the quantity of fruits imported to Sri Lanka;
(ii) the money that has been incurred on that;
(iii) the countries from which those fruits were imported; and
(iv) the companies which imported those fruits?
(b) Will he also inform this House of the total expenditure on importing fruits to Sri Lanka during the period concerned?
(c) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Johnston Fernando) , * . * : * : * Answer tabled:
: : ILLEGAL SAND MINING IN ELUWANKULAMA: CURBING 481/2020 8 . ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Thushara Indunil Amarasena) - (2):
* . * . * Placed in the Library.
(ii) ;
(ii) ;
asked the Minister of Environment:
(a) Is he aware that an illegal sand mining smuggle has been underway in the old Eluwankulama area in Wanathawilluwa in Puttalam District for quite some time without sand mining permits?
(b) Will he inform this House- (i) of the measures taken by the Ministry to curb this illegal sand mining smuggle so far; and (ii) the measures to be taken in future?
(c) If not, why?
( ) (The Hon. Johnston Fernando) , * . * : * : * Answer tabled:

Sir, my point of Order is this. Standing Order No. 83 (1), which was also referred to by the Government side, states, I quote:

"The personal conduct of the President, or the Acting President, Members of Parliament, Judges or other persons engaged in the administration of justice shall not be raised except upon a substantive motion; ..."
So, it states "The personal conduct". , . 83(1) , " , ,

, . . [ ] . . ( ) (The Hon. Presiding Member) .. . 5 . [2.43 p.m.] .. ( .. ) (The Hon. G.G. Ponnambalam) Hon. Presiding Member, since this Adjournment Debate is on gazette notifications and other similar

circulars that are not used for the purpose for which they were issued, I would like to draw the attention of the House to a Gazette Notification that came out on 12th May, 1933. It was a Gazette Notification issued pursuant to a survey done by the Survey Department of a land in Kurunthoor-malai kadu in Mullaitivu, which the Department of Archaeology had asked to be surveyed because there were valued archaeological artefacts in that area. Pursuant to the request, the Survey Department made the survey and on the 15th of March, 1932, Survey Plan 8312 was issued. This Gazette Notification came out in 1933, reserving four plots of land in Kurunthoor-malai kadu as an archaeological reserve.

Despite that, Hon. Presiding Member, that particular spot has been a venerated site, a purana religious site, of Tamils who have been praying there for generations and in fact, that practice has been going on year in, year out. Even during the war and after, those people have been going there and on every Thai Pongal Day, they go and pongu there. But this year, all of a sudden, about two weeks ago, that area has been cordoned off by the Army - by the 591st Brigade - refusing to allow the people to go there on Thai Pongal Day to do their usual prayers. We were told that that archaeological reserve is due to be excavated by the Department of Archaeology and as a result, the people have been prevented from going there.

Sir, you should know that in 2018, there were Buddhist monks who went to that very same site, wanted to place a Buddha stupa there and make it a Buddhist temple. The matter went before the Muallaitivu Court and the court made a ruling that the Buddhist monks were acting illegally and, in fact, insisted that if the Department of Archaeology is going to do anything, they should do it with the University of Jaffnas Archaeological Department and that the people, till then, must be allowed to go and do their usual activities. Then, on the 14th of December, 2020, again there had been a request made by the Department of Archaeology to have that area re-demarcated and the Survey Department sent a surveyor there who has, for the first time, Sir, referred to that land, which has thus far never been referred to by any religion, as the ancient site of Kurundi Viharaya. By a surveyor, not even by the Department of Archaeology! That Department has not even excavated the site; it has not even done its job. But, an ordinary surveyor has got the expertise, it seems, to identify that place as a Buddhist viharaya.

So, Sir, what is happening is what I mentioned during the Budget. This Government is not empowering the people of the North-East who have suffered for over 32 years of war. They are pauperized, deliberately kept in that position. But, infrastructure is being given prominence, is being given preference. A Buddhist viharaya is being given preference. Why? Because you are impoverishing the people of the North-East. ( ) (The Hon. Presiding Member) .
.. ( .. ) (The Hon. G.G. Ponnambalam) I am winding up, Sir.

You are pauperizing them so that they cannot compete with the rest of the country and you are facilitating colonization to take place to change the demography of that area. We condemn this act! The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena is here. He is an Hon. Member who has been in politics for generations; his family too. In some way, he must prevail upon this Government to stop this sort of practice. This is downright racism! ( ) (The Hon. Presiding Member) ... . 7 .
